Package com.millicast

Class BitrateSettings

java.lang.Object
com.millicast.BitrateSettings
public class BitrateSettings extends Object
Customize the bitrate settings for publishing. Setting min bitrate to a really high value could result in inconsistent streams. Network bandwidth must be taken into account. All values are in kilobits per second.

  • Field Details

    • disableBWE

      public boolean disableBWE
      Disables the built-in bandwidth estimation algorithm. This allows users to send the maximum bitrate without any congestion control. When using this option, you have to set the bitrate using the `maxBitrateKbps` option in this struct, which will force the implementation to send that bitrate at all times, regardless of the network bandwidth. Only use this option if you know your network can handle the bitrate you set.

    • startBitrateKbps

      public Optional<Integer> startBitrateKbps
      This value is used to set the starting bitrate value of the publisher The higher the value, the faster the ramp up to the maximum bitrate is.

    • maxBitrateKbps

      public Optional<Integer> maxBitrateKbps
      Sets the maximum publisher's bitrate. Publisher's bitrate will attempt to always reach this value unless restricted by the publisher's available outbound bitrate. The default value is 2500.

    • minBitrateKbps

      public Optional<Integer> minBitrateKbps
      Sets the minimum publisher's bitrate. If publisher's available outbound bitrate is less than this value, the stream might not be able to attain that minimum bitrate and could end up being choppy. The default value is 0.

  • Constructor Details

    • BitrateSettings

      public BitrateSettings()
